items.content_html:
Summary

From Fx112, overlay will be recognized as a value for overflow (fixed in this bug).

Update in spec:

User agents must also support the overlay keyword as a legacy value alias of auto.

Description of changes

In addition to the changes related to overlay, the following changes have been made:

  • Two glossary pages, Scroll container and Scrollport, have been updated so that the verbiage is similar in both the pages and matches that used on the overflow page. The redundant "See also" section in both the pages has been removed.
  • Minor 1-sentence addition has been made to the overflow-clip-margin, overflow-x, and overflow-y pages.
  • Major rewrites have been done on the overflow page to:
    • include all the information in the spec.
    • make all the keyword descriptions follow the same order of information.
    • change the overlay keyword info to a note because the spec still lists five possible keywords (visible | hidden | clip | scroll | auto) in the syntax.
    • add clip to the example.
    • move the external link in the "Accessibility concerns" section to the "See also" section.
    • format the "See also" section to group similar properties into separate list items. Also to remove the Firefox-specific link (Debug scrollable overflow).

To Dos

  • Update overlay info in the browser compat table
  • Update firefox release note

Related issues

Doc issue tracker: #25355
Bug tracker: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1817189
Spec: https://w3c.github.io/csswg-drafts/css-overflow/#overflow-control
items.title: docs(fx112-css-overflow): Add note for 'overlay' and update other descriptions

items.content_html:
Supersedes #24282.

As usual this PR got a bit more involved.

The current page: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Guide/Introduction#getting_started_with_javascript is very Firefox-centric. I've updated it to be more browser-agnostic. I've linked to the browser's devtools docs instead of copying it, where I could find any (I could not find usable devtools docs for Safari).
items.title: Update console intro instructions

items.content_html: addresses some concerns of #10781
items.title: Order of transform functions matters

items.content_html:
Fixes #25697 as outlined in #25697 (comment).

The overview was very PWA-y, so I tried to clarify that manifest is not necessarily only for PWAs, although they are the most important use case.

I wasn't sure if it would be better to remove the tables entirely from the members, now they only have Type, or not. I do quite like the formal presentation you get with a table, compared to having types in prose, like: "The icons member is an Array of objects..."

However we do usually have types in prose (for properties or parameters, say). For example:

The read-only body property of the Request interface contains a ReadableStream with the body contents that have been added to the request. Note that a request using the GET or HEAD method cannot have a body and null is returned in these cases.
items.title: Fix 25697: clarify mandatory status of manifest members

items.content_html: This PR updates the Learn/Forms/Sending_and_retrieving_form_data page to mention additional frameworks for each language, and categorize the frameworks by programming language for convenience.
items.title: Mention other server-side frameworks and categorize by language

items.content_html: Add a commit I forgot to push before merging, to address https://github.com/mdn/content/pull/25305/files#r1141517607.
items.title: Add chat apps as a use case for push

items.content_html:
Description

Removed whitespace in CSS snippet example that caused unintended behavior.

Motivation

Teaches a correct example of combining selector types.

Additional details


  body h1 + p .special {
    color: yellow;
    background-color: black;
    padding: 5px;
  }

According to the exercise description:

'This will style any element with a class of special, which is inside a paragraph...'

There shouldn't be any whitespace between 'p' and '.special'. If there is, then the CSS selector may not match the desired elements.
items.title: Removed whitespace between 'p' and 'special'

items.content_html:
this PR is replacing #25550, because "Github hates me"

this is a non-technical page because it really is hard to find how to install and mostly how to uninstall a PWA. Will link to it from the intro tutorial so developers can install the app multiple times (and uninstall) as they develop PWAs. This page is intentionally non-technical.
items.title: New PWA install and uninstall page.

items.content_html: Dropping copy paste from the spec and writing actual description for VideoEncoder and its methods.
items.title: More informative docs for VideoEncoder

items.content_html:
Description

Adds a note that event pages need to listen to runtime.onStartup to ensure that they run at least once per browser session.

Motivation

To address the documentation update requirements for Bug 1820331 If the background script of an MV3 extension has a browser.action.onClicked() handler, the background script is not executed on startup.
items.title: runtime.onStartup event page behavior clarification

items.content_html:
Description

This is in scope of the PWA docs project: mdn/mdn#280

In this project, we are adding new guides, tutorials, and how-to pages. We also discussed about adding a reference page that would list all of the APIs/methods/manifest members that PWAs can use.

This is exactly what this PR offers. It adds a new page with links to all of the relevant PWA reference docs: manifest members, service worker APIs, other web APIs.

Motivation

This new page should help PWA devs quickly scan through the list of possible features and APIs and jump to other pages to learn more.

Related issues and pull requests

Part of mdn/mdn#280
items.title: New reference page for PWA

items.content_html:
Description

It's not explicitly clear that 303 is a temporary redirect. Add clarification in HTTP 303 description to specify that it is a temporary redirect.

Motivation

Multiple status codes often perform the same function, with the only difference between them being that one is temporary and one is permanent. This is often the most important item that people wonder about with redirect status codes; which ones are temporary and which ones are permanent.

This should be information explicitly provided on all redirect status descriptions.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: cleanup: Explicitly clarify that HTTP 303 is a temporary redirect

items.content_html:
Bumps markdownlint-rule-search-replace from 1.0.9 to 1.0.10.

Commits
  • See full diff in compare view

Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting @dependabot rebase.

Dependabot will merge this PR once CI passes on it, as requested by @mdn-bot.

Dependabot commands and options

You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR:

  • @dependabot rebase will rebase this PR
  • @dependabot recreate will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it
  • @dependabot merge will merge this PR after your CI passes on it
  • @dependabot squash and merge will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it
  • @dependabot cancel merge will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging
  • @dependabot reopen will reopen this PR if it is closed
  • @dependabot close will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually
  • @dependabot ignore this major version will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
  • @dependabot ignore this minor version will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
  • @dependabot ignore this dependency will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
items.title: Bump markdownlint-rule-search-replace from 1.0.9 to 1.0.10

items.content_html:
Description

Second sentence in the example text "It demonstrates how, for an animation that runs for an infinite time, you can cause it to remain in its final state rather than reverting to the original state (which is the default)" was changed to "It demonstrates how, for an animation that runs for specified time, you can cause it to remain in its final state rather than reverting to the original state (which is the default)" because example crearly shows that animation time is set for 3s and not for infinite time.

Motivation

Just wanted to help creators and users of the website.
items.title: Updated article example text
